problem_text:
a) Let G = ⟨α, β⟩ be the group generated by the following two permutations of Z:
α(n) = n + 1;
β(0) = 0,
β(2km) = 2k(m + 2), where m is odd and n is a positive integer. Is G amenable?
V. V. Nekrashevich
answer: a) Yes, it is (G. Amir, O. Angel, B. Vir´ag, J. Eur. Math. Soc., 15, no. 3 (2013), 705–730).
